page.enlisting:
• The short-wave channels have large degradation, especially channel 8 with the annual decay rate up to 14%. • In the red and near-infrared bands (600 ~ 900nm), e.g. channel 3,4,13,14,15 and 16, the calibration coefficients almost have no change with the annual decay rate below 1%. • The short-wave channels have large degradation, especially channel 8 with the annual decay rate up to 14%.

page.enlisting:
•Calibration coefficients during annual field campaign at Dunhuang in Aug. 2010 were estimated using the formula from multi-sites tracking analysis. •The percent difference between estimated coefficients and vicarious calibration with in- situ data are below 5%(exept for CH18). •Calibration coefficients during annual field campaign at Dunhuang in Aug. 2010 were estimated using the formula from multi-sites tracking analysis.

from multi-sites tracking
analysis.

page.title:
Difference Analysis with Model Estimation
Difference Analysis with Model Estimation

Double Difference Analysis with MODIS
Double Difference Analysis with MODIS

Conclusion
Conclusion
page.enlisting:
• The multi-sites radiometric calibration tracking method could provide the re-calibration coefficients for MERSI. • This current method is not good for water absorption • The multi-sites radiometric calibration tracking method could provide the re-calibration coefficients for MERSI.
• The multi-sites radiometric calibration tracking method
could provide the re-calibration coefficients for MERSI.
• This current method is not good for water absorption
• This current method is not good for water absorption
channels. Near real-time humidity profiles may be helpful to improve.
channels. Near real-time humidity profiles may be helpful
to improve.
• Primary re-calibration performance shows that the RMS percentage difference with MODIS is 5.6, 3.5, 3.4 and 3.4% for MERSI bands at 470, 550, 650 and 865 nm by double differencing, but MERSI is systematically larger at 470nm .
• Primary re-calibration performance shows that the RMS
percentage difference with MODIS is 5.6, 3.5, 3.4 and
3.4% for MERSI bands at 470, 550, 650 and 865 nm by
double differencing, but MERSI is systematically larger
at 470nm .
